newsitem.title: USA: North American strep vaccine shows promise.
newsitem.headline: North American strep vaccine shows promise.

text.p: North American Vaccine Inc said Wednesday a clinical trial has shown promising results from a vaccine to prevent group B Streptococcus, a disease that kills 5 to 8 percent of the newborns it affects.
North American said the vaccine is based on technology exclusively licensed to it from Brigham and Women's Hospital, Harvard University, and the National Research Council of Canada.
North American said there is currently no vaccine approved or sold to prevent GBS infections in infants or adults.
It said Brigham and Women's Hospital and Harvard University announced the results, in which the vaccine was well tolerated and showed no serious side-effects.
The company said it is preparing for expanded trials with with Brigham and Women's Hospital to test the safety and efficacy of the vaccine.
North American shares closed Tuesday at 17-3/8.
